channel.title: Quick question on server.java
channel.description: Sorry guys, this is probbably self explanatory, but my router was all sorts of messed up, and i port forwarded two of them to get to this point (should only be like a 15 minute job but it took me 3 hours) >.< anyway, when i change the IP from "localhost" in my server java do i use my internal, or my external ip adress? Same with the client, in the settings java. Both internal, or external to make it public for everyone? I port forwarded port 80 and 43594 or whatever it was.. Any help would be appreciated. thanks in advance :)

item.title: Quick question on server.java
item.dc:creator: @aaronsc aaronsc
item.description:
@aaronsc wrote:

Sorry guys, this is probbably self explanatory, but my router was all sorts of messed up, and i port forwarded two of them to get to this point (should only be like a 15 minute job but it took me 3 hours) >.< anyway, when i change the IP from “localhost” in my server java do i use my internal, or my external ip adress? Same with the client, in the settings java. Both internal, or external to make it public for everyone? I port forwarded port 80 and 43594 or whatever it was… Any help would be appreciated. thanks in advance
